articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Dow plunges amid fears coronavirus will tank global economic growth
articles.description: The stock market took a steep nose dive Monday over concerns the coronavirus is already cutting into the global economy. Companies dependent on Chinese supply lines and international travel are among the hardest hit stocks.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Surge in coronavirus outside mainland China fuels concerns of a potential global pandemic
articles.description: Cases of the virus have spread far beyond mainland China, where the government says strict quarantines have slowed infection rates locally.

articles.author: Erika Edwards
articles.title: Coronavirus is not yet a pandemic — but countries should prepare
articles.description: Is the coronavirus a pandemic? Not yet, according to the World Health Organization, even though cases have risen significantly in Italy, South Korea and Iran.
articles.content:
The new coronavirus that's sickened tens of thousands of people in Asia is not a pandemic, but has the potential to become one if countries don't work together to slow its spread, the World Health Organization said Monday.
Concern about possible widespread g… [+2086 chars]

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Long lines for face masks in city at center of South Korea’s coronavirus crisis
articles.description: Drone video provided by South Korean media showed customers waiting in line outside an E-mart store on Monday morning. E-mart began to sell 1.41 million face masks at half price in Daegu, according to local media reports.

articles.author: Martha C. White
articles.title: Dow plunges by 950 points on fears coronavirus will tank global economic growth
articles.description: All three major indices plummeted at Monday's opening bell as reported cases of the coronavirus surged, sparking widespread fear that the disease would negatively affect global economic growth.
articles.content:
Wall Street plunged at Monday's opening bell after a spike in the number of reported cases of coronavirus fueled fears that the epidemic would have a serious impact on global economic growth.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell by more than 950 points at t… [+3309 chars]

articles.description: China reported 150 new coronavirus deaths Monday, bringing the toll to 2,592.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Malaysian PM submits resignation in shock move
articles.description: It was also not immediately clear what the king's next step would be and whether Prime Minister Mahathir could form another government.
articles.content:
KUALA LUMPUR Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad has submitted a letter of resignation to the country's king, his office said on Monday, leaving the government in limbo amid talk of forming a new governing coalition.
